examples.sentence: I solemnly swear I'm up to no good.
When I said 'I do', I didn't mean doing laundry forever.
The circuit shows 5A I flowing through.
The I signal triggered emergency protocols.
The I register stores critical operation codes.

examples.sentence: Shakespeare's sonnets often use iambic pentameter.
The da-DUM rhythm of iambic resembles a heartbeat.
Modern rap battles still use iambic for its punchy effect.
The iambic in this poem sounds like galloping horses.
The patient developed an iatrogenic infection after surgery.
Iatrogenic diabetes can occur from long-term steroid use.
Her anxiety was later confirmed to be iatrogenic, caused by the doctor's pessimistic prognosis.
The iatrogenic weight gain resulted from the prescribed medication.
Antibiotic-induced diarrhea is a common iatrogenic disease.

examples.sentence: The Iberian ham hanging in the restaurant costs more than my phone.
Flamenco dance reflects Iberian cultural complexity.
This ancient Iberian inscription remains undeciphered.
The linguist specializes in extinct Iberian languages.
Ancient Iberians traded salted fish with the Phoenicians.
Modern Iberians still debate whether paella originated in Valencia.
Few records of Iberian survive except some bronze tablets.
Scholars believe Iberian influenced early Basque.
The Iberian Peninsula is shaped like a stretched cowhide.
The Iberian lynx is rarer than a honest politician.
The ibex scaled the vertical cliff like a furry Spiderman.
Tourists in Switzerland often mistake ibex horns for tree branches.
The Alpine ibex population has recovered since hunting bans.
The sacred ibis was worshipped in ancient Egypt as a symbol of Thoth.
We spotted a flock of ibises wading in the wetlands near Shanghai.
Mummies of sacred ibises were found in the same tomb as pharaohs.
The ice on Houhai Lake sparkled like broken beer bottles.
Her voice had the clarity of ice cracking in winter.
The durian ice melted faster than my salary disappears.
Kids scream for ice cream like seagulls chasing chips.
The mooncake's ice crust shattered like glass under teeth.
Her rejection came with the ice of Harbin in January.
The corrupt official accepted ice wrapped in red envelopes.
The wizard iced the moat with a wave of his staff.
Iced Tsingtao beer tastes better with spicy crayfish.
The baker was icing mooncakes with robotic precision.
The river iced over like a giant skating rink.
He broke the ice by sharing spicy hotpot horror stories.
You're on thin ice if you forget her zodiac sign again.
The Titanic met its fate after hitting an iceberg.
Scientists say 90% of an iceberg is hidden underwater.
Don't be such an iceberg - smile at your fans!
Her iceberg attitude melted when she saw the puppy.
The leaked documents are just the tip of the iceberg.
Your test score is merely the tip of the learning iceberg.

Ice cream stored in the icebox develops fewer ice crystals.

examples.sentence: The iced wind from Siberia made my WeChat steps freeze at 8.

The WiFi icon disappeared from my taskbar.
Panda has become a global cultural icon of China.
The battery status icon turns red when below 10%.
The panda cub climbing a tree became an iconic image of Chengdu.
Her cheongsam with pizza print is truly iconic in fashion history.
Spicy hotpot has achieved iconic status in Chongqing's culture.

examples.sentence: During the Byzantine Iconoclasm, countless religious artworks were smashed.
Protestant reformers practiced iconoclasm by whitewashing church frescoes.
The tech giant's iconoclasm challenges traditional business models.
Her PhD thesis explores punk music's cultural iconoclasm.
The young director's iconoclasm brought fresh air to the film industry.
Silicon Valley thrives on its culture of technological iconoclasm.
The Enlightenment was an era of intellectual iconoclasm across Europe.
Banksy's graffiti represents contemporary artistic iconoclasm.
The Byzantine iconoclasts destroyed religious statues with hammers.
Like an iconoclast, he tore down the celebrity posters in his teenage bedroom.
Elon Musk is considered an iconoclast for challenging traditional auto industry norms.
This feminist iconoclast smashed the teapot symbolizing 'women's duty' in her TED talk.
Jack Ma was a digital iconoclast who transformed China's payment habits.

Post-90s generation shows iconoclastic spirit by job-hopping frequently.

examples.sentence: The Dunhuang frescoes provide rich iconographic resources for studying Tang Dynasty costumes.
This app collects iconographic data from 1,000+ historical sites.
Her thesis analyzes the iconographic differences between Guanyin statues in Fujian and Zhejiang.
The museum's iconographic research revealed hidden patterns in Ming Dynasty portraits.
The Terracotta Warriors show astonishing iconographic precision in facial details.
WeChat's iconographic emoji set has become a new cultural phenomenon.
The panda has evolved into an iconographic symbol of Chinese diplomacy.
Moutai's red ribbon packaging carries deep iconographic meanings.
The iconographic analysis of Journey to the West murals took 3 years to complete.
Chinese New Year pictures continue an unbroken iconographic tradition since the Song Dynasty.
The museum's Buddhist iconography includes a 3D-printed lotus throne.
Dianping uses food iconography to make reviews more appetizing.
IKEA's furniture assembly iconography saves 60% translation costs.
The subway map iconography in Tokyo uses color-coded anime characters.
Her PhD thesis on Tang Dynasty makeup iconography went viral.
The iconography of Confucius evolved from scholar to meme template.
The red star remains powerful in China's political iconography.
WeChat's 'red envelope' has become global digital iconography.
The bartender served cocktails with icy diamonds from Antarctica.
Her engagement ring sparkled like an icy morning in Harbin.
The watermelon turned icy after 3 hours in the fridge.
His fingers were icy from building snowmen without gloves.
She gave him an icy stare when he mentioned her ex.
The customer service representative's tone was icy cold.
The icy sidewalk caused 5 people to slip in 10 minutes.
Drivers should beware of icy bridges in winter mornings.
The icy wind from Siberia makes Beijing feel like a freezer.
After the quarrel, there was an icy relationship between the roommates.

examples.sentence: His idea of mixing bubble tea with durian caused a staff revolt.
I got the idea to use hotpot as team building activity.
The idea of bike-sharing solved last-mile problems in cities.
Her idea of using Douyin for teaching made classes go viral.
The idea of common prosperity guides China's development.
His idea is to create a Mandarin-learning app with AI panda tutors.
Confucius' ideas still influence modern education systems.
The idea of harmony is key in traditional Chinese medicine.
The idea of 'digital yuan' was confusing to elderly at first.
Young kids may not grasp the idea of QR codes being magic.
Do you have any ideas about solving traffic jams during holidays?
Her ideas on Gen-Z workplace culture sparked heated discussion.
After three explanations, he finally got the idea of health code colors.
I had no idea hotpot could have durian soup base until today!
His ideal is to open a panda-themed hotpot restaurant in Chengdu.
The Confucius Temple represents the ideal of Chinese education.
The ideal of 'harmony between humans and nature' dates back to Daoism.
Marx's ideals continue to influence modern economic theories.
The ideal of the project is to create a self-sufficient eco-village.
The Great Wall is an ideal spot to watch sunrise during National Day.
Her Mandarin pronunciation is ideal for a foreigner.
Some consider communism an ideal society that may never exist.
The ideal world in Buddhist teachings differs from physical reality.
Plato's ideal philosophy contrasts with materialist views.
The BMI chart shows my ideal weight should be 10kg less.
In an ideal world, we would all have 3-day weekends.
Berkeley's idealism claims reality is mentally constructed.
Some argue that quantum physics supports idealism.
His idealism led him to volunteer in war zones.
The startup failed because of the founder's unchecked idealism.
The young idealist quit his job to save endangered pandas.
Every startup founder starts as an idealist holding a unicorn plushie.
The philosopher argued like an idealist about the nature of reality.
In the debate, he played the role of the idealist against materialists.
Kant's idealist philosophy influenced modern thought profoundly.
Her idealist approach ignored practical constraints.
The idealist proposal got 0 votes in the budget meeting.
His idealist views on education were considered too radical.
He went from being a starving idealist to a pragmatic entrepreneur.
The novel portrays an idealist worldview through its protagonist.

The young teacher's idealistic approach collided with the reality of students sleeping in class.
Plato's idealistic philosophy contrasts sharply with modern materialism.
Her idealistic belief that thoughts can alter reality reminds me of The Secret.
The idealistic poet refused to write commercial jingles for toothpaste ads.
As an idealistic artist, he would rather starve than compromise his vision.
Idealistically, every student should have access to quality education.
He spoke idealistically about world peace at the TEDx talk.
She idealistically believed she could finish the 10,000-word essay in one night.
Planning to visit 30 countries in a month is traveling idealistically.

The utopian novel idealizes a world without social classes.
Confucius idealized benevolent governance in The Analects.
He often idealizes about being a superhero.

examples.sentence: The philosopher's ideational framework influenced modern psychology.

Every student answered identically in the exam, which made the teacher suspicious.
The AI robots reacted identically to voice commands.

examples.sentence: The suspect was wearing an identifiable red cap with pandas.
Ancient Chinese porcelain often has identifiable reign marks.
The handwriting expert confirmed the signature was identifiable as authentic.
DNA evidence made the victim's remains identifiable after 20 years.
The suspect's tattoo was identifiably unique among 10,000 database records.
Peking duck is identifiably different from other roasted ducks by its crispy skin.
The two dialects are identifiably distinct in their vowel pronunciations.
Facial identification failed when she wore the Peking opera mask.
The AI's voice identification confuses Sichuan dialect with Cantonese.
Your ID card is the most common form of identification in China.
The panda keeper used his staff identification to enter the breeding base.
Young people show strong identification with hanfu culture.
Her identification with the heroine made her cry during the movie.
His identification with revolutionary heroes inspired his career choice.
The hotel requires foreign guests to present passport as identification card.

examples.sentence: The anonymous donor later became an identified philanthropist.
As an identified vegan, she always checks ingredients meticulously.
The identified antique vase was auctioned for 8 million yuan.
Only identified organic products get this certification label.
The AI system marked all identified spam emails with red flags.
Identified suspicious transactions will trigger bank alerts immediately.
